structMember.name: qualityLevelValueOptionI
structMember.description: Specifies the Telecom option for European standard.

structMember.name: qualityLevelValueOptionII
structMember.description: Specifies the Telecom option for United States standard.

structMember.name: qualityLevelValueOptionIII
structMember.description: Specifies the Telecom option for Japanese standard

struct.name: QualityLevelValueOld
struct.description:
The quality level in synchronization networks.
QualityLevelValue is an exclusive struct, including 3 struct member stand for three hierarchies of quality levels in different synchronization networks defined in ITU-G.781. Which member is used is decided by the selected telecomStandard.

structMember.name: qualityLevelValueOptionI
structMember.description:
Hierarchy of quality levels in Option I synchronization networks.
Runtime to support - flag: if-configure telecomStandard of Synchronization is OPTION_I

structMember.name: qualityLevelValueOptionII
structMember.description:
Hierarchy of quality levels in Option II synchronization networks.
Runtime to support - flag: if-configure telecomStandard of Synchronization is OPTION_II

structMember.name: qualityLevelValueOptionIII
structMember.description:
Hierarchy of quality levels in Option III synchronization networks.
Runtime to support - flag: if-configure telecomStandard of Synchronization is OPTION_III

enumMember.name: SIGNALOK
enumMember.description: Status of station output clock is OK.

enumMember.name: SQUELCHED
enumMember.description: Station output clock is squelched.

enumMember.name: PRC
enumMember.description: Primary Reference Clock. Highest quality level

enumMember.name: SSU_A
enumMember.description: Synchronization Supply Unit class A. Second quality level

enumMember.name: SSU_B
enumMember.description: Synchronization Supply Unit class B. Third quality level

enumMember.name: SEC_EEC
enumMember.description: Synchronous Equipment Clock/ Ethernet Equipment Clock. Fourth quality level

enum.name: QualityLevelValueOptionIOld
enum.description: Hierarchy of quality levels in Option I synchronization networks.

enumMember.name: QL_PRC
enumMember.description: QL_PRC in Option I.

enumMember.name: QL_SSU_A
enumMember.description: QL_SSU_A in Option I.

enumMember.name: QL_SSU_B
enumMember.description: QL_SSU_B in Option I.

enumMember.name: QL_SEC
enumMember.description: QL_SEC in Option I.

enumMember.name: QL_DNU
enumMember.description:
QL_DNU in OptionI.
Do not use.

enumMember.name: QL_FAILED
enumMember.description:
QL_FAILED in OptionI.
Signal in Fail state.

enumMember.name: QL_NSUPP
enumMember.description:
QL_NSUPP in OptionI.
Not support the SSM processing.

enumMember.name: QL_UNC
enumMember.description:
QL_UNC in OptionI.
The output signal is not connected to an input, but instead to the internal unconnected signal generator.

enum.name: QualityLevelValueOptionIIOld
enum.description: Hierarchy of quality levels in Option II synchronization networks.

enumMember.name: QL_PRS
enumMember.description: QL_PRS in Option II.

enumMember.name: QL_ST2
enumMember.description: QL_ST2 in Option II.

enumMember.name: QL_TNC
enumMember.description: QL_TNC in Option II.

enumMember.name: QL_STU
enumMember.description: QL_STU in Option II.

enumMember.name: QL_DUS
enumMember.description: QL_DUS in Option II.

enumMember.name: QL_ST3E
enumMember.description: QL_ST3E in Option II.

enumMember.name: QL_ST3
enumMember.description: QL_ST3 in Option II.

enumMember.name: QL_SMC
enumMember.description: QL_SMC in Option II.

enumMember.name: QL_ST4
enumMember.description: QL_ST4 in Option II.

enumMember.name: QL_PROV
enumMember.description: QL_PROV in Option II.

enumMember.name: QL_FAILED
enumMember.description:
QL_FAILED in OptionII.
Signal in Fail state.

enumMember.name: QL_NSUPP
enumMember.description:
QL_NSUPP in OptionII.
Not support the SSM processing.

enumMember.name: QL_UNC
enumMember.description:
QL_UNC in OptionII.
The output signal is not connected to an input, but instead to the internal unconnected signal generator.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: Function is enabled.

enumMember.name: DISABLED
enumMember.description: Function is disabled.

enumMember.name: UNK
enumMember.description: The quality level of the synchronization source is unknown. Highest quality level

enumMember.name: SEC_EEC
enumMember.description: Synchronous Equipment Clock/ Ethernet Equipment Clock. Second quality level

enum.name: SelectionProcessMode
enum.description: Specifies if the quality processing is enabled for input and output.

enumMember.name: QL_ENABLED
enumMember.description: Quality processing is enabled for input and output.

enumMember.name: QL_DISABLED
enumMember.description: Quality processing is disabled for input and output.

enum.name: SwitchCommand
enum.description:
External commands per selection process.
CLEAR - A clear (CLR) command clears the forced switch and manual switch commands. FORCED - The forced command overrides manual switch, and a subsequent forced switch. It can be cleared by the CLEAR command. MANUAL - A manual switch request overrides a previous manual switch request.

enumMember.name: CLEAR
enumMember.description:
CLEAR command.
A clear (CLR) command clears the forced switch and manual switch commands.

enumMember.name: FORCED
enumMember.description:
FORCED command.
The forced command overrides manual switch, and a subsequent forced switch. It can be cleared by the CLEAR command.

enumMember.name: MANUAL
enumMember.description:
MANUAL command.
A manual switch request overrides a previous manual switch request.

enumMember.name: PRC
enumMember.description: Operational quality is PRC in option I.

enumMember.name: PRS
enumMember.description: Operational quality is PRS in option II.

enumMember.name: STU_OR_UNK
enumMember.description: Operational quality is STU in option II or UNK in option III.

enumMember.name: SSU_A_OR_TNC
enumMember.description: Operational quality is SSU-A in option I or TNC in option II.

enumMember.name: SSU_B
enumMember.description: Operational quality is SSU-B in option I.

enumMember.name: ST2
enumMember.description: Operational quality is ST2 in option II.

enumMember.name: ST3E
enumMember.description: Operational quality is ST3E in option II.

enumMember.name: ST3_OR_EEC2
enumMember.description: Operational quality is ST3/EEC2 in option II.

enumMember.name: SEC_OR_EEC
enumMember.description: Operational quality is SEC/EEC in options I or III.

enumMember.name: SMC_OR_EEC1
enumMember.description: Operational quality is SMC/EEC1 in option II.

enumMember.name: PROV
enumMember.description: Operational quality is PROV in Option II. QL PROV is not supported. It is interpreted as invalid.

enumMember.name: DNU_OR_DUS
enumMember.description: Operational quality is DNU/DUS (Do Not Use for Sync) in all options.

enumMember.name: INV
enumMember.description: Operational quality is INV (Invalid) in all options.

enumMember.name: TCU_02
enumMember.description: An Ericsson TCU02 or SIU is detected upstream.

enumMember.name: QL_UNKNOWN
enumMember.description: Quality level cannot be retrieved or is undefined.

enumMember.name: TNC
enumMember.description: Operational quality is TNC in option II.

enumMember.name: SMC
enumMember.description: Operational quality is SMC in option II.

enum.name: ReferenceStatusOld
enum.description:
Status of sync reference.
The value is deceided by the current capability of underlying sync port.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: FAILED means this reference is not available.

enumMember.name: BIDIRECTION
enumMember.description: BIDIRECTION means this reference can receive and send sync signal.

enumMember.name: MASTER
enumMember.description: MASTER means this reference can only send sync signal, can't receive.

enumMember.name: SLAVE
enumMember.description: SLAVE means this reference can only receive sync signal, can't send.

enum.name: QualityLevelValueOptionIIIOld
enum.description: Hierarchy of quality levels in Option III synchronization networks.

enumMember.name: QL_UNK
enumMember.description: QL_UNK in Option III.

enumMember.name: QL_SEC
enumMember.description: QL_SEC in Option III.

enumMember.name: QL_FAILED
enumMember.description:
QL_FAILED in OptionIII.
Signal in Fail state.

enumMember.name: QL_NSUPP
enumMember.description:
QL_NSUPP in OptionIII.
Not support the SSM processing.

enumMember.name: QL_UNC
enumMember.description:
QL_UNC in OptionIII.
The output signal is not connected to an input, but instead to the internal unconnected signal generator.

enum.name: QualityLevelValueOptionII
enum.description: Telecom option for United States standard.

enumMember.name: PRS
enumMember.description: Primary Reference Source. Highest quality level

enumMember.name: STU
enumMember.description: Synchronization Traceability Unknown. Second quality level

enumMember.name: ST2
enumMember.description: STratum 2 clock. Third quality level

enumMember.name: TNC
enumMember.description: Transit Node Clock. Fourth quality level

enumMember.name: ST3E
enumMember.description: STratum 3 Enhanced clock. Fifth quality level

enumMember.name: ST3_EEC2
enumMember.description: STratum 3 clock./ Ethernet Equipment Clock. Sixth quality level

enumMember.name: SMC_EEC1
enumMember.description: SONET Minimum Clock/ Ethernet Equipment Clock. Seventh quality level

derivedDataType.name: WaitToRestoreTime
derivedDataType.description:
wait to restore time of sync reference.
According to section 5.9, G.781, the value of WTR time is configurable in the range of 0 to 12 (minute), default value is 5 minutes.

derivedDataType.name: CurrentWTR
derivedDataType.description:
The current wait to restore time if the sync reference is in WTR state.
The range is 0..*, unit is second. Products implements specific max value '*'.

derivedDataType.name: ReferencePriority
derivedDataType.description:
Priority of sync reference.
Products implement specific max priority value '*'. The relation is present as: “1” > “2” >“3” > ..>“*” > disabled. 0 means the reference is disabled.

derivedDataType.name: HoldOffTime
derivedDataType.description:
Hold off time of sync reference.
According to section 5.8,G.781, the value of HoldOfTime is configurable in the range of 300 to 1800 (ms). But some products need implement this attribute exceed the range. So there will be no constraint on it in the model, include the range and unit.

class.name: StationOutputClock
class.description:
Implements the station output clock functionality.
Several StationOutputClockReference instances shall be associated with it to join the station output clock selection algorithm. The creation of its instance could be triggered when create Synchronization (root of sync fragment).

action.name: setStationClockSwitchCommand
action.description:
Set external command for station output clock.
It is a sync action. switchCommand could be CLEAR, MANUAL or FORCED. switchReference could be any equipment clock reference.

parameter.name: switchCommand
parameter.description: The switch command type, value shall be "CLEAR", "FORCED", "MANUAL".

parameter.name: switchReference
parameter.description: The switch cmd reference, value shall be the switch cmd specific station output clock reference. If switch cmd is "CLEARED", it shall be ignore. In this case, its value could be NULL.

action.name: useEquipmentClock
action.description: Directly use equipment clock as station output clock.

attribute.name: stationOutputClockId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: currentStationClockReference
attribute.description:
Shows the current selected station output clock reference.
When the clock is experiencing a forced command, the shows value shall be equal to stationClockSwitchReference. It shows NULL if no clock reference is slelected.

attribute.name: stationClockSwitchReference
attribute.description:
Shows the current station output clock switch command reference.
It shows NULL if current command is CLEARED.

attribute.name: stationClockSwitchCommand
attribute.description: Shows the current station output clock switch command.

attribute.name: stationClockSquelchLevel
attribute.description:
Specifies the squelch quality level for station output clock.
stationClockSquelchLevel is only available when product implement QL-Enable mode. User shall set SquelchLevel by selecting it from a given QL list. The value in the list can be product specific, and must be complied with the selected telecom standard. If Quality value of station output clock is inferior than SquelchLevel, all output station clock should be squelched.

attribute.name: holdOffTime
attribute.description:
Specifies the hold-off time for station output clock.
It is available for all station output clock reference. According to section 5.8,G.781, the value of HoldOff time is configurable in the range of 300 to 1800 (ms). But some products need implement this attribute exceed the range. So no constraint on the range and unit, products could define them.

attribute.name: waitToRestoreTime
attribute.description:
Specifies the wait to restore time for station output clock.
According to section 5.9, G.781, the value of WTR time is configurable in the range of 0 to 12 (minute), default value is 5 minutes. It is available for all Equipment clock reference. User can clear the WTR state per reference.

attribute.name: clockState
attribute.description:
Shows the state of station output clock.
SIGNALOK - Status of station output clock is OK. SQUELCHED - Station output clock is squelched.

attribute.name: stationClockPriorityTable
attribute.description:
Shows all station output clock references in one place.
Value will be NULL if no station output clock reference existed.

attribute.name: selectionProcessMode
attribute.description:
Specifies the selection process mode for station output clock.
QL_ENABLED - Station output clock selection process works in QL_ENABLED mode. QL_DISABLED - Station output clock selection process works in QL_DISABLED mode.

class.name: StationOutputClockReference
class.description:
Sync Reference for station output clock.
Create its instance, specify an underlying encapsulation, then this reference will join the station output clock selection algorithm. Upper number of StationOutputClockReference instance shall be product specific.

action.name: clearWTR
action.description: Clear the WTR state for a sync reference.

attribute.name: stationOutputClockId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description:
Specifies the priority of synchronization reference.
The priority value must be unique within the clock.

attribute.name: lockOut
attribute.description:
Specifies the lock state of sync reference.
ENABLED - The reference is in lockout state. This cause it to be no longer considered available by the selection process. DISABLED - The reference can be considered available.

attribute.name: useReceiveQL
attribute.description:
Specifies if sync reference use received quality level to join the selection process.
useReceiveQL is only used in QL_ENABLED.
true - operQuality is used to join the selection process. false - adminQuality is used to join the selection process.
Runtime to support - flag: if-configure selectionProcessMode is QL_ENABLED

attribute.name: operQuality
attribute.description: Shows the quality level extracted from underlying sync port.

attribute.name: adminQuality
attribute.description:
Specifies administrative quality level of sync reference.
SyncReference uses adminQuality to join the selection process when useReceiveQL is false. User sets adminQuality by selecting QL from a given QL list. The value in the list can be product specific, and must be complied with the selected telecom standard.
Runtime to support - flag: if-configure useReceiveQL of SyncReference is false AND selectionProcessMode is QL_ENABLED

attribute.name: encapsulation
attribute.description:
Underlying physical interface. it is used to hide different physical type of sync port. Specifies the underlying encapsulation of sync reference.
The encapsulation of sync reference is used to hide different physical types of sync port. Products define which type could be used as encapsulation.
Constraint - flag: An transmit port can be use in only one reference for each clock type

attribute.name: referenceStatus
attribute.description:
Shows the status of sync reference.
The value is deceided by the current capability of underlying sync port.
FAILED - Sync reference is not available. BIDIRECTION - Sync reference can receive and send sync signal. MASTER - Sync reference can only send sync signal, can't receive. SLAVE - Sync reference can only receive sync signal, can't send.

attribute.name: currentHoldOffTime
attribute.description:
Shows the current hold-off time if the sync reference is in hold-off state.
If the sync reference is not in hold-off state, the value is 0.
Optional to support - Flag : if-feature SyncHoldOffTime

attribute.name: currentWTR
attribute.description:
Shows the current wait to restore time if the sync reference is in WTR state.
If the sync reference is not in WTR state, the value is 0.
